Total retention adjustment breakdown
Retention adjustment Calculation Sub-total
Total student funding £19,985,637
Adjusted proportion of continuing or completed students (retention factor)
Calculation: Multiply 		Multiply 0.94529

Decrease 0.02
Total student funding
Calculation: Minus 		Minus £19,985,637
Total adjustment based on withdrawing students
Calculation: Equals 		Equals -£1,093,413

Increase £399,712
How adjusted proportion of continuing or completed students is calculated

Retained students from October 2020 return (R14) ÷ total funded students = proportion of continuing or completed students

(Proportion of completing or continuing students ÷ 2) + 0.5 = adjusted proportion of continuing or completed students

Total programme cost weighting uplift breakdown
Programme cost weighting uplift Calculation Sub-total
Programme cost weighting 1.07086
Total student funding after retention adjustment
Calculation: Multiply 		Multiply 19,291,935
Total student funding after retention adjustment
Calculation: Minus 		Minus 19,291,935
Total adjustment for subjects that cost more to deliver
Calculation: Equals 		Equals £1,367,027
Where programme cost weighting comes from

The weighting is based on the sector subject area classification for each student’s core aim. It is calculated using data from the October 2020 return (R14).

Total high needs
Places: 217 		217 £1,302,000
Where place numbers come from

Place numbers are either rolled forward from 2020 to 2021 or your local authority agreed it with ESFA. This provides a base level of funding.

You must agree additional funding above this level with your local authority. Local authorities pay you the top-up funding directly. It is not shown in this statement.
